# Library Guidance Docs

## NuGet

- [NuGet](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/nuget.md): Best practice recommendations for packaging with NuGet for .NET libraries.
- [Dependencies](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/dependencies.md): Best practice recommendations for managing NuGet dependencies in .NET libraries.
- [Source Link](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/sourcelink.md): Best practice recommendations for using Source Link to improve debugging for .NET libraries.
- [Publishing](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/publish-nuget-package.md): Best practice recommendations for publishing .NET libraries to NuGet.

## Open-source library guidance

- [Open-source library guidance](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/index.md): Best practice recommendations for developers to create high quality .NET libraries.
- [Get started](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/get-started.md): Getting started building .NET libraries.
- [Cross-platform targeting](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/cross-platform-targeting.md): Best practice recommendations for creating cross-platform .NET libraries.
- [Strong naming](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/strong-naming.md): Best practice recommendations for strong naming .NET libraries.

## Versioning

- [Versioning](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/versioning.md): Best practice recommendations for versioning .NET libraries.
- [Breaking changes](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/library-guidance/breaking-changes.md): Best practice recommendations for navigating breaking changes when creating .NET libraries.
